intro: Micropholis longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed micropholis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody, shrub-like growth habit. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
